games.models.synTF_chem module

Created on Thu Jun 16 09:11:29 2022

@author: kate

class synTF_chem(parameters: List[float] = [1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1], inputs: Optional[List[float]] = None, input_ligand: float = 1000, mechanismID: str = 'default')[source]

Bases: object

Representation of synTF_chem model

solve_single(parameter_labels: List[str]) → Tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray][source]
Solves synTF_Chem model for a single set of parameters and inputs, including 2 steps

  1. Time from transfection to ligand addition

  2. Time from ligand addition to measurement via flow cytometry

Parameters

parameter_labels – a list of strings defining the parameter labels

Returns

  • solution – An array of ODE solutions (rows are timepoints and columns are model states)

  • t – A 1D array of time values corresponding to the rows in solution

static gradient(y: numpy.ndarray, t: numpy.ndarray, parameters: list, inputs: list, mechanismID: str) → numpy.ndarray[source]

Defines the gradient for synTF_Chem model.

Parameters

  • y – an array defining the initial conditions (necessary parameter to use ODEint to solve gradient)

  • t – an array defining the time (necessary parameter to use ODEint to solve gradient)

  • parameters – a list of floats defining the parameters

  • inputs – a list of floats defining the inputs

  • mechanismID – a string defining the mechanism identity

Returns

a list of floats corresponding to the gradient of each model state at time t

Return type

dydt

solve_experiment(x: list, dataID: str, parameter_labels: List[str]) → list[source]

Solve synTF_Chem model for a list of ligand values.

Parameters

  • x – a list of floats containing the independent variable

  • dataID – a string defining the dataID

  • parameter_labels – a list of strings defining the parameter labels

Returns

A list of floats containing the value of the reporter protein at the final timepoint for each ligand amount

Return type

solutions

static normalize_data(solutions_raw: List[float], dataID: str) → List[float][source]

Normalizes data by maximum value

Parameters

  • solutions_raw – a list of floats defining the solutions before normalization

  • dataID – a string defining the dataID

Returns

a list of floats defining the dependent variable for the given dataset (after normalization)

Return type

solutions_norm

static plot_training_data(x: list, solutions_norm: List[float], exp_data: List[float], exp_error: List[float], filename: str, run_type: str, context: str, dataID: str) → None[source]

Plots training data and simulated training data for a single parameter set

Parameters

  • x – list of floats defining the independent variable

  • solutions_norm – list of floats defining the simulated dependent variable

  • exp_data – list of floats defining the experimental dependent variable

  • exp_error – list of floats defining the experimental error for the dependent variable

  • filename – a string defining the filename used to save the plot

  • run_type – a string containing the data type (‘PEM evaluation’ or else)

  • context – a string defining the file structure context

  • dataID – a string defining the dataID

Return type

None
